rComments: WORST ONLINE CLASS EVER!!! There was an error every week with our online lecture video and or homework assignments. TA's were useless as well. When ever any student asked for help there was never a clear answer given. I bombed both my midterm and final but because of the heavy load of homework I barley survived.

I took this class for fun and ended up hating it. It was online and for one of the quizzes I didn't get notified when I needed to take it and missed the deadline. I emailed her and asked how I could retake it or make up the points and she didn't let me do anything and I got a C in the class because of it. This class isn't worth it!

Very boring (plagiarized!?) lectures and poorly designed course.  The lectures were beginning to sound so dry and oddly structured that I got curious so I transcribed them and looked them up online and discovered that they were a near exact ripoff of Wikipedia articles and USGS publications of which she was not an author.

For an upperclassmen who has taken many classes this class by far was the worst class ever. Most of the assignments are unclear and she tells us to watch the videos (lectures online) when sometimes the videos have no clarity to our assignment. And when students ask for help she gives them vague answers expecting us to know it all. DO NOT TAKE!

Rude!! I emailed her to clarify an obvious misunderstanding on her part that affected my grade---totally ignored everything I said and snapped at me! Obviously just didn't want to admit she'd made an error. Can't wait to do the official evals. We're students, not subordinates. Lots of people have dropped or switched to PNP, very poorly run course!

I usually get pretty bored in Earth Science classes, but she was able to make things more interesting. There are no exams in this class. There are 2 individual reports. And instead of a final there's a big group (6-7 ppl) report with a 45 min presentation. Overall a good learning experience and pretty good teacher.
She is a good geologist but a horrible teacher. Such a bad class. She does not explain things well and makes us do stupid work. Class is not that hard though.

She tends to jumble her words but not so much that you can't understand her.  she goes too fast to write any notes down, however she makes up for it for having the slides online and no final. Overall easy class, but if your a seasoned earth science major and want to learn something new, this may be boring and she doesn't do much to make it fun

She is a great professor, I don't understand what some people are so negative about her. She explains everything and gives plenty of opportunity for extra credit. You will learn a lot of the geology that shaped our national parks and what still going on.

I was really excited to take this class but after a few weeks of lecture was not.  This class isnt as interesting as it seems, but its an easy A or B and if you're the kind of person that likes skipping lectures this is the right class for you.  If you're planning on learning a lot about National Parks you should go on a trip or read a book instead

She goes off on tangents and her lectures don't really teach you anything you didn't know already about parks. She mostly explained vocab which can get boring. I would suggest going to section because I actually learned hands on there.

Susan was an extremely boring lecturer who showed wayyyy too many pictures and often went off on tangents that didn't matter.  My TA was extremely unhelpful and never helped me actually LEARN the subject, which was way annoying.  Book was a waste of $60, but at least you don't have to take the final if you have a B or better.
She does explain everything that is needed for homeworks yet class is pretty SLOW and sometimes boring and she shows wwwaaaaaaayyy too many pictures of the same thing

She explains EVERYTHING. Going if you go to class everyday (like college students should) you will not be missing anything that would be on your test. though she can have her moments of stray and at some points be a bit boring (but hey it is science), all the stuff she explains is perfect. She also leaves times open to earn extra credit.

I took this class to fulfill a general education requirement, yet I ended up enjoying it.  The professor is mainly interesting and engaging, however there are some times when the lectures are a bit boring.  I would recommend this class to anyone who wants to fulfill the IN general education requirement.
